business.headline: From 20s to retirement: How bonds strengthen your financesBonds don't grab headlines like stocks, but they quietly strengthen your finances across life stages. From building discipline in your 20s to ensuring stability in retirement, they remain a steady anchor for wealth creation. Here's how they work for you.
Document shows India resisting complete crypto regulation: ReportWhile some countries like Japan and Australia are developing frameworks to regulate digital assets carefully, India remains cautious.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains on US trade deal hopes and Fed rate cut buzzThe NSE Nifty 50 climbed 104.50 points to close at 24,973.10, while the BSE Sensex added 323.83 points, ending at 81,425.15. The Nifty has now gained for six straight sessions, with the Sensex rising in five of the last six trading days.

Festive season stocks that you should add to your portfolioWith people ready to spend on home appliances, beauty products, lifestyle goods, and automobiles, investors are now looking for stocks that could benefit from this surge in demand.

Is your credit score falling? Here's how to fix itHas your credit score recently taken a hit? You're not alone. Many people discover a drop only when applying for a loan or credit card. The good news is, most reasons are easy to fix with a few smart steps.

Fitch raises India's growth forecast to 6.9% for FY26 on strong Q2 performanceThe revision comes after India's real GDP grew by 7.8% in the April–to-June quarter, surpassing expectations and marking an acceleration from the 7.4% growth seen in the previous three months.

Delhi High Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assetsThe legal dispute over the estate of the late businessman Sanjay Kapoor has reached the Delhi High Court. A suit has been filed by Karishma Kapoor's two children, who claim they are entitled to their father's personal assets as legal heirs. The High Court has registered the suit and will hear the matter on the 9th of October to decide on an interim stay. The children contend they have been informed they are not beneficiaries under Sanjay Kapoor's will, which they are now questioning and allege has been forged. In response, Priya Kapoor's counsel has told the court that the children "have already been given 1900 crore worth of assets six days before the suit was even filed." The Delhi High Court has directed Priya Kapoor to file a list of all movable and immovable assets of Sanjay Kapoor known to her.

This crypto exchange eyes $3 billion IPO with Nasdaq backingThe company, backed by the Winklevoss twins, plans to sell 16.67 million shares at a price between $24 and $26 each, up from its previous range of $17 to $19 per share.

Why affordable housing demand is slowing down in IndiaAffordable housing was once the backbone of India's housing dream, offering budget-friendly options to urban families. But today, demand in this segment is slipping, as buyers increasingly feel these homes don't match their needs.

Can Karisma Kapoor's children get a part of Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore empire?The lawsuit from Karisma Kapoor's children accuses their stepmother Priya Sachdeva of withholding critical information and details about Sunjay Kapur's will. The hearing for this case is scheduled for today, September 10, 2025.

Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assets after lawsuitDelhi High Court has asked Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit a detailed list of all movable and immovable assets belonging to the late Sunjay Kapur.

Tax on gold jewellery? Here's all you need to knowWondering if your gold jewellery attracts income tax? The answer depends on whether you simply own it or decide to sell it. Here's a quick look at how the tax rules work in India.

entertainment.headline: Kunickaa Sadanand's son Ayaan says her relationship with Kumar Sanu was very toxicActor Ayaan Lall opened up about his mother Kunickaa Sadanand's relationship with singer Kumar Sanu. He clarified the timeline and describes the relationship as toxic, shedding light on her post-divorce life.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle: A beginner's guide to the world-class anime hitWith 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' releasing soon, fans in India can catch up by watching just a few key episodes instead of the entire series. The film has already set records with advance bookings and early morning screenings, promising an exciting experience for anime lovers.

Is Shehbaz Badesha's entry into Bigg Boss 19 a low-key TV nepotism moment?Shehbaz Badesha, brother of actor Shehnaaz Gill, is the first wild card contestant of 'Bigg Boss 19'. He made a brief appearance in the reality show's 13th season to support his sister. But does he deserve to be in this season?

After Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan files plea on misuse of personality rightsAfter Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan moved Delhi Court over personal rights protection.  He wants a ban on the unauthorised use of his images, name, voice, and performances.

Kunickaa gets support from 'doodhwala community', actor's son shares proofBigg Boss 19's Kunickaa Sadanand faced criticism inside the house but received unexpected support from the local 'doodhwala community.' Her son Ayaan Lall showcased this backing by sharing a video of milkmen rallying behind her.

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle and the rise of anime films in IndiaDemon Slayer: Infinity Castle is breaking box office records with over Rs 30 crore in advance bookings. This success signals a major shift as anime moves from niche to mainstream in India.

Varun Tej-Lavanya Tripathi welcome baby boy, Chiranjeevi congratulates new parentsSouth actor couple Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi have announced the arrival of their first child, a baby boy. They announced pregnancy in May 2025.

The Paper review: Not The Office, but awkwardly charming in its own wayRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025The Paper series review: 'The Paper', a new comedy series streaming on Peacock and JioHotstar, brings a newsroom twist to the awkward humour fans loved in 'The Office'. Set in a struggling paper company in Toledo, it offers a fresh yet relatable take on office politics and journalism struggles in 2025.

Kantara Chapter 1's Kerala release in trouble over profit-sharing disputeKerala Film Exhibitors Union has halted the screening of Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. There's a rising dispute over profit sharing with Prithviraj Sukumaran, who is distributing the film in the state.

Viral: Janhvi Kapoor dances to Bijuriya with Ishaan Khatter and Vishal JethwaActors Janhvi Kapoor, Ishaan Khatter, and Vishal Jethwa's dance to the 'Bijuriya' song is going viral. In less than 24 hours, the video has garnered more than 17 million views. The song is from the upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Kiss trailer: Kavin, Preethi Asrani headline quirky romance comedy with a twistThe trailer of the upcoming Tamil film 'Kiss', featuring Kavin and Preethi Asrani, was recently released, and it seems to be much more than just a simple rom-com. The film will release in theatres on September 19.

Akshay turns 58 with cards, karaoke and joker by his side. Twinkle shares glimpseActor Akshay Kumar's birthday bash started as early as 7 am on Tuesday and lasted all day on September 9. His actor-turned-author wife, Twinkle Khanna, gave a glimpse into his birthday celebrations in her latest post.

Actor Teja Sajja opens up on Mirai journey, calls Mahavatar Narsimha educationalAfter the blockbuster success of 'Hanu-Man', Telugu actor Teja Sajja is back with 'Mirai', a fantasy action drama that blends mythology, VFX, and breathtaking real locations. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he opens up about the challenges, risks, and his vision for telling stories beyond commercial cinema.

Kurukshetra: Netflix adapts the Mahabharata into a 2-part animated seriesNetflix recently announced a new series named 'Kurukshetra', drawing inspiration from the ancient Indian epic the Mahabharata. The series will release in two installments of nine episodes each.

Ashneer Grover on comparisons with Salman Khan: Not here to be a cloneAshneer Grover debuts as host of Amazon MX Player's Rise and Fall, facing comparisons to Salman Khan. He emphasises his unique style and rejects being seen as a clone, aiming to offer fresh content to audiences.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle advance booking: Rs 15 crore done, history in makingJapanese anime film 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' sets records in India with advance ticket sales exceeding expectations. The film is scheduled to release on September 12, breaking prior anime records.

Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle: When and where to watch the unscripted talk showThe release date of the upcoming talk show 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle' has been announced. The unscripted series will feature actors Kajol and Twinkle Khanna as co-hosts.

Vayuputra, 3D animation film on Lord Hanuman announced. First-look poster outProducer Naga Vamsi shared the announcement about a new 3D animation film, Vayuputra, on his social media with an animated poster featuring Lord Hanuman. The animated film will be directed by Chandoo Mondeti of 'Thandel' fame.

Singer Armaan Malik meets Tim Cook and ATEEZ's Yunho at Apple keynoteSinger Armaan Malik's meets Tim Cook and Yunho at Apple Park and becomes the first Indian musician to attend Apple's keynote. Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Nanda, was also present at the event.

general news.headline: Nepal's Gen Z picks Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim leaderFormer Chief Justice Sushila Karki has emerged as Gen Z's top choice for Nepal's head of interim government after over 5,000 young people backed her during a nationwide virtual meeting.

Nationwide voter roll revision SIR likely to begin by OctoberThe announcement for a nationwide Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter roll could come even before the Bihar elections conclude, sources said.

Look at neighbours, proud of our Constitution: Chief Justice Gavai cites Nepal turmoilChief Justice of India BR Gavai cited turmoil in Nepal and Bangladesh turmoils to underline the strength of the Indian Constitution.

This is how friends negotiate: US singer on Trump, PM Modi's posts on trade talksEarlier today, Trump called PM Modi his "very good friend", while the Prime Minister framed the talks as a way to unlock the "limitless potential" of the India-US trade and strategic partnership.

New iPhone is here and it is time again for the Holy WarWhether you're Team Apple or Team Android, you're all suckers in this grand smartphone scam. These devices promise connection but deliver isolation: one notification at a time. So next time you pull out your precious gadget, remember: it's not a status symbol, it's a shiny leash.

Who is BHU-educated Sushila Karki tipped to head Nepal?Sushila Karki is likely to be Nepal's next Prime Minister. Karki, who was Nepal's first woman chief justice, studied at India's Banaras Hindu University (BHU). She is known for zero-tolerance on corruption, and was hit by an impeachment motion in 2017 over alleged judicial activisim.

Donald Trump's return gift to Qatar: $400 million betrayalA White House official said that the US was informed well in advance of Israel's strike in Qatar to target Hamas leaders. The fact the strikes occurred in Qatar, a close ally of the US that has worked to cultivate Trump, only contributed to the sense of betrayal.

Who set Nepal on fire? Violence shocks Gen Z protesters themselvesWho set Nepal on fire? Nepal's Gen Z protesters said they aren't to blame for the arson and violent attacks on leaders. They claimed that they were, in fact, trying to prevent violence and pinned the blame for the arson on "political opportunists". This suggests that the protests in Nepal were hijacked, like last year's Bangladesh agitation.

Return of the Relic: How Prophet's stolen hair returned to Hazratbal mysteriouslyIn 1963, Kashmir's most sacred relic vanished, sparking mass unrest, political blame, and enduring suspicion. Its mysterious return restored faith for some but left a haunting question: was it truly the same?

Indian students create solar storm alert system using Aditya-L1Indian students have developed a new system that could give an early warning about an incoming solar storm from the Sun. The system will enhance safety for space missions and infrastructure protection.

Air-Fauda: 5 reasons why the Israeli Air Force can strike West Asia at willIAF jets have struck Hamas in the Gaza Strip, crossed borders into southern Lebanon to assassinate Hezbollah chief Hasan Nasrallah, destroyed the Syrian navy and air force, and the defence headquarters in Damascus.

Indian tourist in Nepal cries for help: Mob torched hotel, chased me with sticksAn Indian woman, who travelled to Nepal for a volleyball tournament, described her harrowing experience in Pokhara, where her hotel was set on fire, and she barely managed to escape.

Jolly LLB 3 trailer: Akshay Kumar-Arshad Warsi go big on their fight for justiceThe makers of Jolly LLB 3 have released the final trailer starring Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi. The courtroom comedy-drama, directed by Subhash Kapoor, showcases the clash between the two Jollies, a socially relevant storyline, and a star-studded cast including Saurabh Shukla, Huma Qureshi, and Amrita Rao. The film hits theaters on September 19.

Live: 5 juvenile inmates dead, nearly 13,000 prisoners escape jails amid Nepal turmoilNepal descended into political turmoil on Tuesday after Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli resigned, as Gen Z-led demonstrations intensified across Kathmandu and other regions. Protesters stormed government buildings, including Parliament and the Prime Minister's Office, and set ablaze the private residences of President Ram Chandra Poudel, Oli, and several former premiers. In response to the escalating crisis, the Nepal Army and top security officials jointly appealed for calm, urging dialogue as the only path to restore order. The Army vowed to safeguard the country's sovereignty, independence, and the lives and property of its citizens while closely monitoring the Gen Z-led movement.

IND v UAE preview: Suryakumar Yadav's India out to justify favourites tagThe Asia Cup opens with India expected to set the tone. The defending world champions will be looking to live up to the billing of outright favourites. The UAE, meanwhile, chase pride in a rare shot against cricket's powerhouse.

CP Radhakrishnan wins Veep poll, but cross-voting claims steal spotlightNDA's CP Radhakrishnan won the Vice-Presidential election with a clear margin. The result is clouded by opposition claims of cross-voting and invalid ballots.
India Today's first look at iPhone 17 AirIndia Today offers an exclusive first look at Apple's latest iPhone 17 Air, highlighting its design and key features.

New France PM's baptism by fire as 'Block Everything' protests rage; 200 arrestedProtesters staged demonstrations across France on Wednesday, disrupting traffic, setting fires and clashing with police in a bid to "Block Everything" in anger at the Macron government.

sports.headline: Arshdeep Singh move up in ICC rankings for bowlers in T20IsIndian spinner Ravi Bishnoi and left-arm seamer Arshdeep Singh moved up to the sixth and 10th spots respectively in the latest ICC T20 rankings released on Wednesday.

India vs UAE LIVE: Will Sanju Samson play in India's opener in Dubai?India (IND) vs United Arab Emirates (UAE) live cricket score and updates: All eyes are on India's team combination as they return to T20I cricket for the first time since January. Will Sanju Samson play or will Jitesh Sharma keep wickets? We are a couple of hours away from the toss. Stay with us for all the live updates from the first Group A match which will be played at Dubai Cricket Stadium.

After World Championships high, PV Sindhu exits Hong Kong Open in first roundHong Kong Open 205: India's top-ranked women's singles star PV Sindhu exited the Super 500 tournament in the first round after losing to lower-ranked Line Christophersen. Lakshya Sen and HS Prannoy, however, progressed to the second round with contrasting wins on Wednesday, September 10.

Bulls re-sign Josh Giddey after record-breaking debut seasonChicago Bulls have re-signed guard Josh Giddey following his impressive debut season. This deal secures a rising star who matched historic NBA milestones and promises a bright future for the team.

India vs Australia 3rd Women's ODI shifted to Hobart from MelbourneThe third women's ODI between India and Australia has been moved from Melbourne to Hobart due to floodlight installation delays. India will play three ODIs, three T20Is and one Test on the tour of Australia in 2026.

Sanju Samson, Jasprit Bumrah miss optional training ahead of Asia Cup openerIndia held their optional practice session a day before their Asia Cup opener. Sanju Samson and Jasprit Bumrah did not opt for practice on Tuesday, September 9.

Holger Rune claps back after Kalinskaya claims he slid into her DMs 10 timesDanish tennis star Holger Rune has responded to Anna Kalinskaya's claims of unwanted advances. He claimed cultural misunderstandings and said he didn't ask her out.

Ashwin slams lack of competition in Asia Cup, suggests inclusion of India AFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised the Asia Cup 2025 for its lack of competitive teams. He suggested including African sides or India A to raise the tournament's standard ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Pakistan doing really well without Babar and Rizwan: Salman AghaPakistan cricket team is rebuilding under captain Salman Ali Agha. Ahead of the their opening match of the tournament, Salman Agha said that they are playing to win the Asia Cup trophy.

Shreyas Iyer's aggressive demeanour under scrutiny? Former spinner speaks outShreyas Iyer's exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad has left many cricket enthusiasts puzzled. Former spinner Maninder Singh supports Iyer's leadership qualities and questions the selection decisions.

Asia Cup: Spoilt for choices, Rashid Khan says leading Afghanistan a tough jobAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan spoke about the challenge of managing the rich spin arsenal of his team. Afghanistan began their Asia Cup 2025 campaign with a massive 94-run win over Hong Kong as they left out Mujeeb ur Rehman.

SA20 Auction: Costliest buys, updated squads after intense bidding warsThe SA20 fourth season auction saw Dewald Brevis become the most expensive player ever. Intense bidding wars highlighted the event, reshaping team squads ahead of the tournament.

Did Suryakumar snub handshake with Pakistan captain? Viral clip clears airAsia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha grabbed the spotlight at the captains' meet in Dubai on Tuesday, as speculation over the two skipping a handshake went viral on social media.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
